ingredients.item: 1 tsp toasted sesame oil, plus extra for rubbing

instructions.step: Preheat the barbecue or griddle to high. Rub the corn with a little sesame oil then cook for 5–10 minutes, turning occasionally, until charred. Set aside until cool enough to handle then cut off the kernels with a sharp knife and keep warm.
Meanwhile, to make the ponzu dressing, combine the soy sauce, mirin, lemon juice and 1 tsp sesame oil in a large bowl.

Slice the carrots and courgettes into ribbons with a vegetable peeler and add to the bowl with the ponzu dressing, corn kernels and sesame seeds. Toss to coat. Garnish with coriander sprigs and serve.
